sen.j: 三上山（みかみやま）は滋賀県野洲市三上にある山。
sen.e: Mt. Mikami is a mountain located in Mikami, Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Mt. Mikami is a mountain located in Mikami, Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Mt. Mikami is a mountain located in Mikami, Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 一般には近江富士として知られる。
sen.e: Popularly, it is known by its nickname Omi-Fuji.
It is popularly known as Omi-Fuji.
It is popularly known as Omi-Fuji.
Elevation: 432m
Elevation: 432m
Elevation: 432m

sen.j: ふもとには御上神社や滋賀県希望が丘文化公園がある。
sen.e: Mikami-jinja Shrine and Kibogaoka Culture Park (Shiga Prefecture) are located at its foot.
Mikami-jinja Shrine and Kibogaoka Culture Park (Shiga Prefecture) are located at its foot.
Mikami-jinja Shrine and Kibogaoka Culture Park (Shiga Prefecture) are located at its foot.

sen.j: 平野部の残丘であるため標高の割には目立ち、琵琶湖をはさんだ湖西からでも望める。
sen.e: Being an iselberg, the mountain stands prominently in the region despite its relatively low altitude and can be viewed from across Lake Biwa from the west bank.
Being a monadnock, the mountain stands prominently in the region despite its relatively low altitude and can be viewed from across Lake Biwa from the west bank.
sen.cmt: iselbergが辞書にない言葉なのでmonadnockに変更しました。
sen.e: Being a monadnock, the mountain stands prominently in the region despite its relatively low altitude and can be viewed from across Lake Biwa from the west bank.

sen.j: 南西部を野洲川が流れる。
sen.e: Yasu River flows to its southwest.
Yasu River flows to its southwest.
Yasu River flows to its southwest.

sen.j: 「古事記」「延喜式」にも記述が見え、また和歌にも詠まれた由緒ある山である。
sen.e: The mountain has been mentioned in "Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters)" and in "Engishiki (Codes and Procedures on National Rites and Prayers)," as well as in "waka" poetry.
The mountain has been mentioned in 'Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters)' and in 'Engishiki (Codes and Procedures on National Rites and Prayers),' as well as in 'waka' poetry.
The mountain has been mentioned in 'Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters)' and in 'Engishiki (Codes and Procedures on National Rites and Prayers),' as well as in 'waka' poetry.

sen.j: 藤原秀郷（俵藤太）による大ムカデ退治伝説が残ることから「ムカデ山」の異名も持つ。
sen.e: It has also earned the nickname Mukade-yama (centipede mountain) from the legend of FUJIWARA no Hidesato (TAWARA no Toda) destroying a giant centipede there.
It has also earned the nickname 'Mukade-yama (centipede mountain)' from the legend of FUJIWARA no Hidesato (TAWARA no Toda) destroying a giant centipede there.
It has also earned the nickname 'Mukade-yama (centipede mountain)' from the legend of FUJIWARA no Hidesato (TAWARA no Toda) destroying a giant centipede there.

sen.j: 観光バスのガイドさんからは「三上山の標高は4×28で428メートルです」と教えられたことがある。
sen.e: In the past, sightseeing bus guides used to describe Mt. Mikami's elevation as "4 x 28 or 428 meters."
In the past, sightseeing bus guides used to describe Mt. Mikami's elevation as '4 x 28 or 428 meters.'
In the past, sightseeing bus guides used to describe Mt. Mikami's elevation as '4 x 28 or 428 meters.'

sen.j: 実際の標高は432メートル。
sen.e: The actual elevation is 432m.
The actual elevation is 432m.
The actual elevation is 432m.

sen.j: 守山市立守山北中学校の校歌に三上山の記載がある。
sen.e: The mountain is mentioned in the school anthem for Moriyama City Moriyama Kita Junior High School.
The mountain is mentioned in the school anthem for Moriyama City Moriyama Kita Junior High School.
The mountain is mentioned in the school anthem for Moriyama City Moriyama Kita Junior High School.

sen.j: 東海道本線野洲駅南東2km
sen.e: 2km southeast of Yasu Station on the Tokaido Main Line
Mt. Mikami is 2 km to the southeast of Yasu Station on the Tokaido Main Line
sen.cmt: 方角の表現を変更しました。
sen.e: Mt. Mikami is 2 km to the southeast of Yasu Station on the Tokaido Main Line
National Route 8 runs in the west side of the mountain
National Route 8 runs in the west side of the mountain
National Route 8 runs in the west side of the mountain
